verses.kjv: The burden which Habakkuk the prophet did see.
verses.ct: This is the message that the prophet Habakkuk received.

verses.kjv: O LORD, how long shall I cry, and thou wilt not hear! even cry out unto thee of violence, and thou wilt not save!
verses.ct: LORD, how long must I call out for help before you listen? I keep crying to you about violence, but you don't rescue anyone!

verses.kjv: Why dost thou shew me iniquity, and cause me to behold grievance? for spoiling and violence are before me: and there are that raise up strife and contention.
verses.ct: Why do you make me witness wrongdoing and force me to look at suffering? Destruction and violence surround me everywhere, and people stir up conflict and arguments.

verses.kjv: Therefore the law is slacked, and judgment doth never go forth: for the wicked doth compass about the righteous; therefore wrong judgment proceedeth.
verses.ct: Because of this, the law has lost its power, and justice never prevails. The wicked surround those who do right, so justice comes out twisted.

verses.kjv: Behold ye among the heathen, and regard, and wonder marvellously: for I will work a work in your days, which ye will not believe, though it be told you.
verses.ct: "Look at the nations and watch closely — be completely amazed! Because I am going to do something during your lifetime that you would never believe, even if someone described it to you."

verses.kjv: For, lo, I raise up the Chaldeans, that bitter and hasty nation, which shall march through the breadth of the land, to possess the dwellingplaces that are not theirs.
verses.ct: "Pay attention — I am raising up the Babylonians, that ruthless and aggressive nation, who march across the whole earth to seize lands that don't belong to them."

verses.kjv: They are terrible and dreadful: their judgment and their dignity shall proceed of themselves.
verses.ct: "They are terrifying and fearsome. They make their own rules and answer to no one but themselves."

verses.kjv: Their horses also are swifter than the leopards, and are more fierce than the evening wolves: and their horsemen shall spread themselves, and their horsemen shall come from far; they shall fly as the eagle that hasteth to eat.
verses.ct: "Their horses are faster than leopards and fiercer than wolves hunting at dusk. Their cavalry charges forward — their riders come from distant lands, swooping down like an eagle diving for its prey."

verses.kjv: They shall come all for violence: their faces shall sup up as the east wind, and they shall gather the captivity as the sand.
verses.ct: "Every one of them comes with violence on their mind. They advance like a scorching desert wind, and they gather up prisoners like sand."

verses.kjv: And they shall scoff at the kings, and the princes shall be a scorn unto them: they shall deride every strong hold; for they shall heap dust, and take it.
verses.ct: "They mock kings and laugh at rulers. They ridicule every fortified city — they simply pile up dirt ramps and capture it."

verses.kjv: Then shall his mind change, and he shall pass over, and offend, imputing this his power unto his god.
verses.ct: "Then they sweep past like the wind and move on, guilty because they credit their own god for their strength."

verses.kjv: Art thou not from everlasting, O LORD my God, mine Holy One? we shall not die. O LORD, thou hast ordained them for judgment; and, O mighty God, thou hast established them for correction.
verses.ct: LORD my God, my Holy One, haven't you existed from eternity? We will not be destroyed. LORD, you have appointed them to carry out judgment. O mighty God, you have put them in place to discipline us.

verses.kjv: Thou art of purer eyes than to behold evil, and canst not look on iniquity: wherefore lookest thou upon them that deal treacherously, and holdest thy tongue when the wicked devoureth the man that is more righteous than he?
verses.ct: Your eyes are too pure to tolerate evil, and you cannot stand to look at wrongdoing. So why do you tolerate those who act with treachery? Why do you stay silent when the wicked destroy people who are more righteous than they are?

verses.kjv: And makest men as the fishes of the sea, as the creeping things, that have no ruler over them?
verses.ct: Why do you treat people like fish in the sea, like creatures that crawl along with no one to lead them?

verses.kjv: They take up all of them with the angle, they catch them in their net, and gather them in their drag: therefore they rejoice and are glad.
verses.ct: The Babylonians pull everyone up with hooks, drag them away in nets, and haul them in with fishing nets. Then they celebrate and throw a party.

verses.kjv: Therefore they sacrifice unto their net, and burn incense unto their drag; because by them their portion is fat, and their meat plenteous.
verses.ct: They even offer sacrifices to their nets and burn incense to their fishing gear, because through these tools they live in luxury and eat the finest food.

verses.kjv: Shall they therefore empty their net, and not spare continually to slay the nations?
verses.ct: Will they just keep emptying their nets and never stop killing nations without mercy?
